column2: Smoked salmon, Cucumber, Cream cheese, Dill, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Using a vegetable peeler slice thin strips of cucumber lengthwise.
column4: 2. Spread cream cheese on each cucumber strip.
column5: 3. Place a piece of smoked salmon on top of the cream cheese.
column8: 5. Roll up the cucumber strips and secure with toothpicks.

column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Tomato, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
column8: 4. In a bowl beat eggs and season with salt and pepper.
column9: 5. Pour eggs over the sauteed vegetables in the skillet.
column10: 6. Cook on the stove top for a few minutes until the edges set.
column11: 7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes until the frittata is set.

column2: Avocado, Eggs, Cherry tomatoes, Fresh basil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Cut avocados in half and remove pits. Scoop out some avocado flesh to create a larger hole.
column5: 3. Place avocado halves in a baking dish to prevent tipping.
column6: 4. Crack an egg into each avocado half.
column7: 5. Top with halved cherry tomatoes chopped fresh basil salt and pepper.
column8: 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes until eggs are set.

column2: Eggs, Spinach, Feta cheese, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column5: 3. In a bowl beat eggs and season with salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Pour eggs into the skillet over the wilted spinach.
column8: 6. Cook until the eggs are set then fold the omelette in half.
column9: 7. Slide onto a plate and serve hot.

column2: Frozen blueberries, Coconut milk, Avocado, Chia seeds (optional), Stevia (optional), Ice cubes
column3: 1. Add frozen blueberries coconut milk avocado and chia seeds to a blender.
column4: 2. Add stevia if desired for sweetness.
column6: 4. Add ice cubes and blend again until desired consistency is reached.
column7: 5. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

column2: Quinoa, Cucumber, Cherry tomatoes, Red onion, Kalamata olives, Olive oil, Lemon juice, Fresh oregano, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. Dice cucumber halve cherry tomatoes thinly slice red onion and chop fresh oregano.
column5: 3. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa diced cucumber halved cherry tomatoes thinly sliced red onion and pitted Kalamata olives.
column6: 4. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
column7: 5. Season with salt pepper and chopped fresh oregano.

column1: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Tofu and Vegetables
column2: Bell peppers, Tofu, Cauliflower rice, Onion, Garlic, Tomato sauce, Olive oil, Italian seasoning, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes.
column5: 3. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saute chopped onion and minced garlic until softened.
column6: 4. Add crumbled tofu and cauliflower rice to the skillet. Cook until heated through.
column7: 5. Stir in tomato sauce Italian seasoning salt and pepper.
column8: 6. Stuff the mixture into the hollowed-out bell peppers.
column9: 7. Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes until peppers are tender.

column2: Salmon fillets, Avocado, Mixed greens, Cherry tomatoes, Cucumber, Red onion, Olive oil, Lemon juice, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Cook salmon until pink and opaque.
column4: 2. Chop mixed greens cherry tomatoes cucumber and red onion.
column6: 4. In a large bowl combine cooked salmon mixed greens cherry tomatoes cucumber and red onion.
column7: 5. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
column8: 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Avocado, Canned tuna, Red onion, Celery, Dijon mustard, Lemon juice, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Cut avocados in half and remove pits.
column4: 2. In a bowl mix canned tuna with finely chopped red onion diced celery Dijon mustard lemon juice salt and pepper.
column5: 3. Spoon the tuna mixture into the hollowed-out avocado halves.

column2: Shrimp, Zucchini, Olive oil, Garlic, Cherry tomatoes, Basil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque.
column6: 4. Add zucchini noodles and halved cherry tomatoes to the skillet. Cook until heated through.
column8: 6. Serve topped with fresh basil leaves.

column2: Salmon fillets, Butter, Garlic, Lemon juice, Fresh parsley, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Stir in lemon juice chopped fresh parsley salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
column7: 5. Pour the lemon garlic butter mixture over the salmon.
column8: 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

column2: Shrimp, Bell peppers, Red onion, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil, Lemon juice, Garlic powder, Paprika, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Thread shrimp bell peppers red onion and cherry tomatoes onto skewers.
column5: 3. In a small bowl mix olive oil lemon juice garlic powder paprika salt and pepper to make the marinade.
column6: 4. Brush the marinade over the shrimp skewers.
column7: 5. Grill skewers for 2-3 minutes on each side until shrimp is pink and opaque.

column2: Tofu, Lemon zest, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, thyme, or rosemary), Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Press tofu to remove excess water then cut into cubes.
column4: 2. In a bowl mix lemon zest chopped fresh herbs olive oil salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Grill tofu skewers for 5-7 minutes on each side until browned and heated through.

column1: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto and Cherry Tomatoes
column2: Zucchini, Cherry tomatoes, Pesto sauce, Olive oil, Garlic, Pine nuts (optional), Basil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Add zucchini noodles and halved cherry tomatoes to the skillet. Cook until heated through.

column8: 6. Serve topped with fresh basil leaves and pine nuts if desired.
